intro: Macrosamanea consanguinea, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and milky sap. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
